extendedInfo.description: CES Mobile is the official Android application for the 2013 International CESÂ®, January 8-11, 2013, in Las Vegas. Know where you are on the show floor and navigate like a pro with our interactive maps, search the exhibitor directory, or create your show schedule by choosing sessions you want to attend and speakers you want to hear.

reviews.title: C++
reviews.comment: Highly ordinary..would like to see a better experience for one of world\'s biggest electronics events.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Zero keynote info
reviews.comment: I missed out on ALL the keynotes because according to this app they don\'t exist. Far less helpful than the many different peices of provided slow literature,  and those are unhelpful and confusing as it is.
reviews.author: Matthew Merrick

reviews.title: Useful, but crashes
reviews.comment: A useful \"go-to\" resource,  but crashes often making it hard to use. Google Nexus One.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Too Slow
reviews.comment: Used this app at the show & wasn\'t fast enough to make practical.  Also kept losing my profile info so had to re enter several times.  Nice to have for minor searches & general info.
reviews.author: Lorraine Balun

reviews.title: Arm saver
reviews.comment: So nice to not need all that paper!
reviews.author: Jeff Wagg

reviews.title: Maps, keynotes, routing
reviews.comment: I used the maps to get around, and the new routing feature was awesome..  I was also able to get to the keynotes and sessions by using the app, the paper was hard to read!
reviews.author: Tommy Denton

reviews.title: Very handy tool
reviews.comment: The maps of the venue are invaluable to an attendee and the interactivity is fantastic.
reviews.author: Beau Griffin

reviews.title: Buggy
reviews.comment: Constantly crashes. Hangs on update. Had to resort to paper <gasp>.
reviews.author: Narayan Sainaney

reviews.title: Could not start app
reviews.comment: \"Failed to download updates\" killed it
reviews.author: Norm Tatlock

reviews.title: Very frustrating
reviews.comment: You would think that an app about technology would be flawless well think again if you go into the list of vendors and star or bookmark something when you go back to the main list you start at the beginning of the list every time
reviews.author: Adam Pape

reviews.title: This appbis really cool!
reviews.comment: Used the app last year too and i like the new features in this one.  Wifi seems stronger around the hall also.  WTG CES!
reviews.author: SweetDeath Co

reviews.title: Doesn\'t sync
reviews.comment: I can\'t sync my vendor selections to the web site. App doesn\'t support intelligent search.
reviews.author: Brett Huhman

reviews.title: Not sure what the complaints are about, seems good
reviews.comment: I was able to find exhibitors, conferences, suites, registration/badge pickup spots intuitively.  The search feature seems good.  I wish the bus schedule was on there.  I couldn\'t find it.  But otherwise, seems like a fair app.  Of course the show hasn\'t started yet.  Last year one of my interns had this app, and we competed to find things, she used the app, I used one of those fat heavy directories.  It was pretty close to a tie. Seems like a pretty good deal to not have to carry a directory around with you.
reviews.author: Chris Mahar

reviews.title: Just as bad as ever
reviews.comment: An app that has 3000 vendors, yet that does not support search. Just a very long scrolling list. What were they thinking? (Probably they weren\'t thinking.j) and the company\'s show the both number, but not what hall they are in.  A truly worthless app.
reviews.author: Don Norman

reviews.title: How can a tech organization have an app this bad?
reviews.comment: Specific issues include:  App has to update every time it is opened. This is fine with a good Internet connection. Not so good when you have 100k people in the same location.   Password reset emails password without user security. Hope no one uses the same password for anything else.   Why does the app always default to Tuesday, not the current date?   These issues are not new and have been in the last 2-3 versions. Is there no interest in making the app better?
reviews.author: Todd Crook

reviews.title: Does not sync maps
reviews.comment: The interactive map on the computer has all my marked interest locations saved. I\'ve logged In on the site and on my mobile. None of my marked booths show up in the app. Very poor execution.
reviews.author: Sean Hunter

reviews.title: Don\'t see the use for it.
reviews.comment: You would think k that an app for a consumer electronics show would be top notch,  but not the case. I would have e thought at the very least I could save favorites to map out my days,  but that doesn\'t seem to be the case. I\'m better off bringing v my laptop and using the browser.
reviews.author: John DeKoven

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Easy to find my way around ces
reviews.author: Alfredo vargas

reviews.title: Maps virtually unusable
reviews.comment: The app is basically the same sad, thrown-together atrocity we\'ve seen for the last few years, as another comment mentioned. I wanted this app for the maps and ability to mark places off as favorites, but you\'re either too zoomed in or too zoomed out to read the maps accurately.  I\'ve even found brands/companies labeled in the wrong areas. The show is amazing, the app is definitely not.
reviews.author: Nicole Cozma

reviews.title: Great
reviews.comment: Smooth
reviews.author: A Google User
